results.title: Breeding for quality
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: England, Denmark, New Zealand and America are the major dairying countries of the world which use artificial insemination. In order to improve the dairy herds in Western Australia the government has set up a research station which supplies commercial herds with semen from top-quality bulls. Records show that artificial insemination has proved its worth to the dairy farmer in increased production, better quality milk and healthier herds.

results.title: Breathless = A bout de souffle [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Georges de Beauregard, Imperia, Productions Georges de Beauregard and Societe Nouvelle de Cinematographie
results.brief_description: When the “young Turks” from the journal Cahiers du Cinema began making films in the late fifties, they revolutionised cinema by celebrating the look and attitudes of American pop-culture (B-movies, rock and roll) while infusing their own films with the uncertainties of a then distinctly European intellectual scrutiny. In “Breathless” a young hood kills a cop and goes on the run in Paris, hiding at his girlfriend’s flat until she betrays him. That’s life. Kiss-kiss, bang-bang. Playful, cool, name-dropping and audacious the film is true to its title, furiously exploring the possibilities of cinema while acknowledging its aesthetic debt to the low-budget films of Hollywood’s B-directors. Godard’s film remains the most influential of the French New Wave, and as the decade was to progress, Vietnam, Algiers and Maoism were to demand of him a more intellectually dense cinema. But in “Breathless” he is still the cheeky precocious brat, thumbing his nose at the world and inventing a new kind of film. From an original treatment by Francois Trauffaut, and with Claude Charbrol as artist and technical adviser. With Jean-Paul Belmondo and Jean Seberg.

results.title: Breathe
results.creator_credit: Yan Wawrzynczak, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Yan Wawrzynczak weaves a moving story about a man, the woman he fell in love with and their child. Over several continents and many years, Wawrzynczak covers the changing seasons of this relationship as the three move in and out of each other’s lives.

results.title: Breath of life
results.brief_description: If breathing stops, the brain can only live three to five minutes. The film shows the importance and technique of mouth-to-mouth resuscitation. It includes the use of examples of emergency situations where this knowledge is applicable. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Breath of life
results.creator_credit: Arthur E Jenks and Queensland. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: Demonstrates mouth-to-mouth resuscitation, with emphasis on four points of procedure. Shows how mouth-to-mouth resuscitation can be used effectively in cases of drowning, electric shock, and obstruction in the throat.

results.title: Breath death: a tragedy in masks
results.creator_credit: S. Vanderbeek and A Visible Fill'm
results.brief_description: An anti-war collage composed of fleeting black and white visual using a variety of animation techniques. The tone of this experimental film is surreal using sources of images and sounds from the 20th Century, opening with the rhythm from Screamin’ Jay Hawkins’ ‘I Put a Spell on You’. Soundtrack by Jay Watt.

results.title: Breast self-examination [revised version]
results.brief_description: An updated and revised version of the film “Breast self examination” (Title code 309812) encouraging women to adopt a simple method of breast self-examination as a regular health habit. Explains that if breast cancer was suspected earlier by women themselves, 80% of patients could be saved by surgery.
